title: Lions' Norris stable after injury ends game early

title: Panthers' Legette, Browns' Jenkins DQ'd for brawl

title: Fever lose Colson, McDonald for rest of season

content: ESPN is acquiring the NFL Network and other NFL media assets, including the linear rights to the league's popular RedZone channel, in a deal that will see the NFL get a 10% equity stake in the all-sports network, it was announced.

title: üßÇ 49ers' Kittle bemoans NFL's smelling salts ban

content: Close out the "SportsCenter" 50-state road trip with nine questions from the Lone Star State to the Keystone State and several in between.

content: Five Pakistani fighter jets and another large aircraft were downed during Operation Sindoor, the Indian Air Force chief said this morning.

title: Russia Builds Shahed-136 Drones Independently, Tensions With Iran Rise
content: Russia's Alabuga drone factory is now upgrading and producing Shahed-136 drones nearly independently, a move that's said to be causing tensions with Iran.

title: Jim Lovell: The Commander Of NASA's Apollo 13 Mission Who Died At 97
content: Jim Lovell's leadership during the near-fatal Apollo 13 mission turned a doomed lunar landing into a story of teamwork, ingenuity, and survival in space.

title: William Webster, Only Person To Lead Both FBI And CIA, Dies At 101
content: William H Webster, the former FBI and CIA director whose troubleshooting skills and integrity helped restore public confidence in those federal agencies, died at the age of 101.

title: Railways Announces Discount On Return Journey Tickets Ahead Of Festive Season
content: The Ministry of Railways has announced an experimental "Round Trip Package for Festival Rush" scheme aimed at easing passenger congestion and ensuring smoother travel during the upcoming festive season.

title: "Defence Production Soars To Rs 1.51 Lakh Crore, Jumps 90% In 5 Years": Rajnath Singh
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Saturday said the annual defence production has soared to an all-time high of Rs 1,50,590 crore in FY 2024-25.

title: Rare 1,000-Year-Old Ceremonial Heads, Ancient Structures Found In Peru
content: The discoveries were made at the Ollape site in the Amazonian district of La Jalca in an area where the Chachapoyas civilization, or "Warriors of the Clouds," developed between 900 and 1,450 AD.

title: Delhi Man Kills Wife, 2 Daughters At Home, Cops Suspect Domestic Dispute
content: A man allegedly killed his wife and two minor daughters, aged 5 and 7, at their home in Delhi's Karawal Nagar area on Friday night.

title: What Sharad Pawar Said On Joining Hands With Nephew Ajit Pawar
content: NCP (SP) president Sharad Pawar on Saturday said Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's presentation on "vote theft" was well-researched and well-documented, and it is up to the Election Commission of India (ECI) to look into the matter.

title: 'Salim Pistol,' India's Most Wanted Arms Supplier, Arrested In Nepal
content: India's most wanted illegal arms supplier, Sheikh Salim alias 'Salim Pistol', has been arrested in Nepal, police said on Saturday.

title: ICICI Bank Raises Minimum Balance From Rs 10,000 To Rs 50,000 For New Customers
content: India's second largest lender ICICI Bank has raised the monthly minimum average balance requirement for all customer segments, effective August 1.

title: Madhya Pradesh Man Arrested For Raping Teen Daughter, Throwing Their Newborn In Bushes
content: A man has been arrested for allegedly raping his 16-year-old daughter, impregnating her and abandoning their newborn baby in the bushes in Madhya Pradesh's Khargone district, police said on Saturday.

title: A Year Since RG Kar Horror: A Look At How Doctor's Rape-Murder Shook India
content: Saturday, August 9, marked one year since the brutal rape and murder of a 31-year-old post graduate trainee doctor at state-run RG Kar Medical College and Hospital in Kolkata.

title: 3,000-Year-Old Skeletons, Believed To Be Human Sacrifices, Found In Peru
content: A research team found the skeletal remains near what is thought to be a ritual temple of the Cupisnique culture, a civilization that thrived more than a millennium before the Incas.

title: After Mumbai, Tesla To Inaugurate Second Showroom In Delhi On August 11
content: US automobile major Tesla has officially announced that it will inaugurate its second showroom in Delhi on August 11, after Mumbai.

title: President Murmu, PM Modi Extend Raksha Bandhan Wishes, Emphasise Bond Of Protection
content: Raksha Bandhan is a festival deeply rooted in Indian culture and has been celebrated for centuries. Incidents of sisters tying rakhi around their brothers' wrists for protection are mentioned in Hindu religious texts.

title: Former Trump Aide John Bolton Flags A Big Cost Of India Tariffs
content: President Donald Trump has jeopardised decades of American efforts to bring India away from Russia and China, his former aide John Bolton has said, pointing to the hefty tariffs that the US has imposed on India for buying Russian oil.

title: Heavy Rain In Delhi Causes Waterlogging, Over 180 Flights Impacted
content: Heavy rain has brought Delhi-NCR to a standstill on Saturday morning, leaving many areas waterlogged and affecting vehicular traffic.

title: NDTV Ground Report: No Land, Papers, Dharali Villagers Stare At Bleak Reality
content: NDTV's visit to the flash flood-affected area in Uttarakhand's Dharali found that only marsh, mud and boulders remained where buildings once stood.

content: Mr. Yadav urged them to teach a lesson to the NDA government by defeating them and their negative politics to form the Mahagathbandhan¬†government in Bihar.

content: Indian Air Force Chief discussed successful Operation Sindoor, showcasing minimal collateral damage and destruction of Pakistan Air Force aircraft

title: Shah's August 29 visit to start process of BJP's political narrative building for 2026 Assam polls: CM
content: The BJP and its allies will seek to form the government for the third successive term in the state in next year‚Äôs assembly polls

content: On the 83rd anniversary of the Quit India movement, the Congress alleged that while the Congress leadership at the time languished in jails, the RSS opposed the movement

title: Himachal govt working on regulating unchecked constructions to mitigate disaster impact: Minister
content: Safety norms and strict regulations would be brought to regulate the construction of houses in rural areas, the Minister said

title: CBI books AIIMS-Bhubaneswar officer, five others for corruption in recruitment
content: The CBI has alleged that Sruti Sagar Kar, an employee of Bombay Intelligence Security (India) Limited (BIS), had conspired to secure permanent employment for his relatives and family members at AIIMS-Bhubaneswar.

title: Rahul Gandhi's 'vote theft' claims are baseless, childish: Bawankule
content: When the Congress wins more seats in the Lok Sabha elections, they celebrate. But when they lose the State Assembly polls, they complain, says Maharashtra Minister Chandrashekhar Bawankule

title: Four choppers deployed to evacuate those still stuck in disaster-hit Uttarkashi
content: A Bailey bridge is being constructed at Limchigad near Gangnani on a war footing to improve road connectivity to the affected areas; power supply to Dharali and surrounding areas was badly hit by the flash flood

content: Of the 171 tourists from Maharashtra, 160 are safe at various locations ‚Äî 31 are in Matli, six in Jolly Grant, and 123 in Uttarkashi ‚Äî and have continued their journey as planned

content: A press conference called by Principal P.K. Jabbar and Superintendent Sunilkumar in the morning purportedly to explain the ongoing situation at  medical college was intended to put Dr. Chirackal under a cloud

title: In pictures: The Rakhi bond in India
content: India is celebrating its Hindu festival Raksha Bandhan, and sisters all over the country eagerly perform the art of tying the Rakhi as a symbol of protection to their brothers. Here we take a look at how the festival is celebrated with unique traditions in different states.

title: One year of RG Kar protest: Activists point to ‚Äòhollowness‚Äô of government‚Äôs promises; say protest emancipated women
content: "The resistance ensured that major heads rolled," said Aniket Mahata, one of the Junior Doctors Front leaders.

title: ECI must clarify discrepancies in voter lists raised by Rahul Gandhi: CWC‚Äôs Gidugu Rudra Raju
content: ECI is not providing electoral data in digital format as it has been encouraging malpractices to benefit the BJP and its alliance partners in the elections, says Congress Working Committee member and former PCC President Gidugu Rudra Raju

title: PM Modi pays tributes to Quit India movement participants
content: PM Narendra Modi said, ‚ÄúWe remember with deep gratitude all those brave people who, under the inspiring leadership of Bapu, took part in the Quit India Movement.‚Äù

title: Manipur, Tripura face challenges on illegal immigration, encroachment: N. Biren Singh
content: Former Manipur Chief Minister along with TIPRA Motha party founder Pradyot Manikya Debbarma, discusses ways to work together to address these concerns

title: NSA Doval meets Russia's First Deputy PM, discusses military-technical ties
content: Ajit Doval is in Russia for crucial talks on energy, defence ties, and to invite President Putin to India

title: Jammu and Kashmir Police searches 26 houses in massive crackdown on terror ecosystem in Kishtwar
content: The raids in Kishtwar came a day after similar searches were conducted at 15 locations in nearby Doda district

title: Two soldiers killed as security forces continue operations in J&K‚Äôs Kulgam
content: Chinar Corps pays tribute to Lance Naik Pritpal Singh and Sepoy Harminder Singh, who laid down their lives in the line of duty

title: Security forces arrest six people in Manipur for extortion
content: One active cadre of the banned Peoples' Liberation Army was arrested on Friday from Huikap Makha Leikai in Imphal East district

title: Trump again claims that he helped 'settle' tensions between India, Pakistan
content: They were going at it, they were going at it big, and they were two great leaders that came together just prior to what would have been a tremendous conflict, as you know, a nuclear conflict, probably, says U.S. President Donald Trump

title: Pro-Khalistan graffiti found at several locations in Amritsar, juvenile among 2 held
content: Commissioner of Police (CP) Amritsar Gurpreet Singh Bhullar said the two were lured into spraying Pro-Khalistan slogans in exchange for monetary rewards, which were never delivered.

title: What makes monsoon the best season for train journeys in India
content: From misty Konkan cliffs to cloud-draped coffee valleys, India‚Äôs boutique trains are offering the season‚Äôs most scenic escapes, no umbrellas required.

title: Planning a monsoon break? Here‚Äôs why South Goa should top your list
content: From forest picnics to sea caves, tribal encounters to tavern trails, Ssouth Goa is emerging as a gentler monsoon escape.

title: India monsoon LIVE: IMD issues yellow alert for most parts of Delhi-NCR; waterlogging in many parts of city
content: Early on Saturday morning, IMD issued a red alert for heavy rain with lightning and thunderstorms for parts of north, west, south, southeast, and Central Delhi, but later downgraded to a yellow alert, advising people to be aware

title: BJP MPs Nishikant Dubey, Manoj Tiwari booked for forcibly entering Baidyanath Temple's inner chamber
content: The ‚Äúforcible entry‚Äù by the MPs and ‚Äúscuffle‚Äù with policemen resulted in causing fear and panic among thousands of devotees present and a stampede-like situation, as per the complaint.

title: Supreme Court stays M.P. High Court order in Saif Ali Khan family property dispute
content: A Bench comprising Justices P.S. Narasimha and Atul Chandurkar issued notice on a plea of Omar Faruq Ali and Raashid Ali, descendants of the elder brother of Nawab Hamidullah Khan, against the High Court‚Äôs order of June 30.

title: J&K government grapples with stinky meat problem, seizes around four tonnes of unsafe mutton¬†
content: A Valley-wide crackdown was sparked after 1,200 kilograms of rotten meat was seized by the Food Safety Department from a cold storage facility operating within the Zakura Industrial Estate in Srinagar on August 2.

title: Heavy rain batters Delhi on Raksha Bandhan, waterlogging in many parts of city
content: Delhi‚Äôs primary weather station at Safdarjung recorded 78.7 mm of rainfall, Pragati Maidan 100 mm, Lodhi Road 80 mm, Pusa 69 mm, and Palam 31.8 mm, according to data shared by the weather department

title: India embarks on indigenous green hydrogen shipbuilding mission
content: Cochin Shipyard Limited and Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders Limited are currently building one ship each, powered entirely by hydrogen fuel cells developed using indigenous technology, Union Minister for Ports and Shipping Sarbananda Sonowal tells Lok Sabha

title: When the written sentence travelled
content: In the 1980s, trunk calls had to be booked to speak to someone back in the village or a distant town. Telegrams had to be fired to break the news of a death or drop a wish for a ‚Äòhappy married life‚Äô. And registered post was the preferred medium to send valuable documents

title: Andhra Pradesh will be dump yard-free State in three years, says Urban Development Minister Narayana
content: The previous government left a legacy garbage of of 85 lakh tonnes, and 65 lakh tonnes of it  has been removed so far, he says

title: Andhra Pradesh sees major boost in road infrastructure under CRIF: Nitin Gadkari
content: In the past three years, including the current financial year, the State has seen 20 State road projects completed, spanning 691 km at a cost of 535 crore, and 55 more projects, covering 534 km, are currently underway with a sanctioned cost of ‚Çπ1,256 crore, he tells Lok Sabha

title: Four die in Karnataka after taking herbal medicine from traditional healer for alcohol de-addiction
content: Traditional healer Fakirappa of Imadapur village in Kalaburagi district arrested and sent to judicial custody following a police complaint

title: CM Naidu to attend International Tribal Day celebrations in ASR district
content: Besides participating in traditional cultural events, the Chief Minister will visit tribal households to understand their living conditions and interact with coffee growers

title: Pune to have three new municipal corporations, says DCM Ajit Pawar
content: Mr. Pawar pointed out that planned development can be achieved with new municipal corporations in place

title: Attack on migrants has received national attention, will be sorted out, says WB Governor
content: The remarks by the Governor assume significance as thousands of migrants from the State have been detained and harassed in the BJP-ruled States

title: Mahayuti takes a dig at Uddhav Thackeray over last-row seating in INDIA Bloc meet
content: BJP says it reflects the importance given to Thackeray in the alliance, Shiv Sena holds satirical protest at memorial of its party founder Balasaheb Thackeray, asking for ‚Äòforgiveness‚Äô for his son

title: Let Election Commission itself submit an affidavit, says Ashok Gehlot
content: Mr. Gehlot said that the Election Commission had made an ‚Äúabsurd demand‚Äù despite knowing the fact that Mr. Gandhi was working under an oath to uphold the Constitution which inherently included strengthening the constitutional institutions.

title: In the name of a nation: The Bengali migrant worker and Indian citizenship
content: As thousands of Bengali-speaking migrants across some of India‚Äôs States are questioned on their citizenship, detained, or pushed into Bangladesh, a wave of fear has brought them back to West Bengal. Shiv Sahay Singh¬†explores the reasons for the migration, as the controversy opens up the debate about Bengali identity. Political parties use the crisis as a plank for the Assembly elections in 2026

title: IAF chief says India shot down 6 Pakistani aircraft; trashes Trump's claim
content: Air Chief Marshal Amar Preet Singh revealed that the Indian Air Force (IAF) successfully shot down five Pakistani jets and an AEW&C aircraft during Operation Sindoor. Speaking at a memorial lecture in Bengaluru, Singh's statement marks the first official confirmation of the extent of damage inflicted on Pakistani aircraft during the cross-border anti-terror operation.

title: Drowning Delhi: Flooded roads, stuck cars and soaked capital - heavy rains lash city
content: Delhi was severely affected by incessant heavy rains, leading to widespread waterlogging and traffic disruptions across key areas like Vasant Kunj and Connaught Place. The India Meteorological Department initially issued a red alert, which was later downgraded to yellow, forecasting continued thunderstorms until August 12. The city recorded significant rainfall, with Safdarjung reporting 78.7 mm.

title: ICICI bank raises minimum balance for new customers: Rs 50,000 in cities
content: ICICI Bank has raised the minimum average balance requirement for new savings accounts opened from August 1st. The new MAB is Rs 50,000 for metro/urban, Rs 25,000 for semi-urban, and Rs 10,000 for rural locations.

title: 'Will not give land to occupier': Zelenskyy rules out ceding Ukraine territory to Russia
content: As Trump and Putin prepare for a summit in Alaska, Zelenskyy insists that no decisions about Ukraine should be made without Ukraine's involvement. He firmly rejects ceding any territory to Russia, emphasizing that Ukrainians will not give their land to the occupier. Zelenskyy believes that any agreement excluding Ukraine is doomed to fail and will not bring lasting peace.

title: Gold again! Gukesh, Pranav and now this ‚Äî Velammal keeps minting talents
content: Velammal MHS School's chess team triumphed at the 2025 World Schools Team Championship, continuing India's chess dominance. The Chennai-based institution, known for nurturing chess talent like GMs D Gukesh and R Praggnanandhaa, provides academic flexibility and professional coaching. Velammal's success, fueled by Chennai's chess culture and support for players, solidifies its reputation as a "Chess Factory."

title: Nvidia CEO checks salaries of company's entire 42,000 employees
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang personally reviews the compensation of all 42,000 employees monthly, utilizing machine learning to optimize the process. He dismisses rumors of secret stock options, emphasizing generous compensation for all workers. Huang believes in prioritizing employee well-being, which he feels drives overall success. This strategy has significantly benefited Nvidia's leadership, creating billionaires within his management team.

title: Delhi restaurant owner apologises after couple denied entry over Indian attire
content: Following outrage over a Delhi restaurant allegedly denying entry to a couple for wearing Indian attire, Tourism Minister Kapil Mishra reported that the owner has apologized and will offer Rakshabandhan discounts for women in traditional wear. An investigation was launched after a video surfaced showing the couple's complaint.

title: Happy Raksha Bandhan: 70+ wishes, messages, quotes & more - check here
content: Raksha Bandhan 2025 is a time to cherish the unique bond shared with siblings, often our first rivals and greatest supporters. This day offers a chance to pause and remember childhood memories, reminding our partners-in-crime of their enduring significance. The celebration emphasizes love, protection, and the unbreakable connection that withstands distance and life's changes.

title: Rakhi with donor‚Äôs hand: Mumbai teen meets her ‚Äònew brother‚Äô in Gujarat
content: In a poignant Raksha Bandhan celebration in Gujarat, Anamta Ahmad, recipient of a hand transplant from the late Riya Mistry, tied a rakhi to Riya's brother, Shivam. This emotional meeting connected two families bound by grief and gratitude, as Anamta became a living embodiment of Riya's legacy. The gesture highlighted the profound impact of organ donation, uniting tradition and humanity.

title: ChatGPT advice lands 60-year-old man in hospital; the reason will surprise you
content: A New York man was hospitalized with dangerously low sodium levels after following a strict, AI-generated diet plan from ChatGPT. The AI tool suggested a toxic substitute, sodium bromide, leading to severe health issues, including hallucinations and neurological symptoms. This case underscores the critical need for professional medical consultation when interpreting AI health advice to avoid misinformation and potential harm.

title: Eastern Ukraine in exchange for peace? Putin's demand ahead of meeting with Trump
content: Donald Trump will meet Vladimir Putin in Alaska on August 15, 2025, to negotiate a potential end to the Russia-Ukraine war. Putin is reportedly seeking control over eastern Ukraine, specifically Luhansk, Donetsk, Zaporizhzhia, and Kherson, along with global recognition of Russia's claims, in exchange for a ceasefire. Trump anticipates territory swaps as part of any peace agreement.

title: Bazball's revolution: How England's bold era is tilting Test cricket towards the batters
content: Since Brendon McCullum's arrival, England's Test cricket has transformed with 'Bazball,' marked by aggressive play and high win rates. This shift coincides with flatter pitches, favouring batters and potentially diminishing the traditional advantage for seam bowlers. While entertaining and popular, this approach raises concerns about the long-term balance of Test cricket, as bowler-friendly conditions become increasingly scarce.

title: Railways launches 20% rebate on return tickets to ease Diwali-Chhath festival rush
content: To ease Diwali and Chhath rush, railways introduces a 'Round Trip Package' offering a 20% fare rebate on return journeys booked together. Bookings open August 14, 2025, for onward travel between October 13-26, 2025, and return travel between November 17-December 1. The scheme aims to manage passenger traffic, improve train utilization, and benefit passengers planning extended vacations.

title: An entire country is shifting to Australia, as first planned migration is underway
content: Tuvalu, a Pacific island nation, faces imminent submersion due to rising sea levels, prompting a groundbreaking planned migration. A treaty with Australia allows 280 Tuvaluans annually to gain permanent residency, accessing essential services.

title: Why are Trump, Putin meeting in Alaska and will Zelenskyy be present?
content: Donald Trump is set to meet Vladimir Putin in Alaska on August 15, 2025, aiming to broker a peace deal to end the Ukraine war. Trump believes he has "a shot" at securing peace, hinting at possible territory swaps. The meeting follows a visit by Trump‚Äôs envoy to Moscow, though Russia dismissed a three-way summit with Zelenskyy.

title: Triple murder in Delhi: Man kills wife, daughters in Karawal Nagar; accused absconding
content: In a tragic incident in Delhi's Karawal Nagar, police are actively searching for a man named Pradeep, who is suspected of murdering his wife, Jaya Shri, and their two young daughters, aged five and seven. Preliminary investigations suggest that ongoing marital disputes may have been a contributing factor in this horrific crime.

title: Trump ‚Äònobel‚Äô for Nobel: Now, Armenia and Azerbaijan back US President for peace prize
content: Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan and Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev have jointly endorsed Donald Trump for the Nobel Peace Prize. This follows a landmark peace agreement mediated by Trump between the two nations, ending decades of conflict. Both leaders lauded Trump's efforts at a White House signing, emphasizing his role in achieving the breakthrough.

title: Arriving in Delhi! Tesla to open second India Showroom - check details
content: Tesla is expanding its presence in India, opening its second showroom in Delhi on August 11, following its Mumbai debut. The new Tesla Experience Centre will be located in Aerocity's Worldmark 3 complex. Tesla officially entered India last month with the launch of its Model Y, with deliveries expected to begin in the third quarter of 2025.

title: Rooting for Joe Root! Can England batter end his wait for a ton Down Under?
content: The Test great has left contemporaries trailing in his dust since the pandemic, so much so that only the inimitable Sachin Tendulkar now stands above him. Can the England batter now correct the one gaping hole in his resume, of not having a three-figure score Down Under?

title: Defence output soars: Annual production in FY25 hits Rs 1.5 lakh crore, says Rajnath
content: India's defence production has reached a record high of Rs 1,50,590 crore in FY 2024-25, marking an 18% increase from the previous year, according to Defence Minister Rajnath Singh. This represents a significant 90% surge since FY 2019-20. Singh attributed this growth to the collaborative efforts of the Department of Defence Production, DPSUs, public sector manufacturers, and the private industry.

title: Make America Baked Again? Trump talks weed over dinner with donors
content: US President Trump has reignited discussions on federal marijuana restrictions, hinting at potential policy changes. During a recent gathering, he acknowledged the need to re-evaluate the existing regulations. This comes nearly a year after he initially suggested easing access to regulated cannabis and granting states greater autonomy. While some advisors see cannabis reform as a boost for the upcoming midterms, others caution against potential legal and moral repercussions.

title: Delhi rains: Yamuna has brush with ‚Äòdanger‚Äô for 2 hours; crosses 205.33m mark
content: The Yamuna River in Delhi reached a seasonal high of 205.15 meters, nearing the danger level before receding. Despite the halt in rainfall, an expert cautioned vigilance due to past late monsoon floods. The flood helped improve water quality by flushing out toxins, highlighting the importance of river flows.

title: Watch: Chaos at Delhi airport as Air India delay angers passengers
content: An Air India flight delay at Delhi's airport sparked a tense confrontation between passengers and airline staff. Frustrated by the delay, passengers engaged in a heated exchange with ground staff, who attempted to calm the situation.

title: IPL: CSK may free up purse to add firepower; Dhoni likely to play
content: Chennai Super Kings are planning a significant rebuild after a disappointing IPL season, potentially releasing seasoned players like R Ashwin and Devon Conway to free up approximately Rs 34.45 cr for the upcoming auction. CSK aims to bolster their batting lineup with a top-order hitter, a strong Indian middle-order batsman, and a quality all-rounder.

title: 'Stop the slide': Royal Caribbean water slide glass breaks mid-way - Watch
content: Panic struck the Icon of the Seas when a water slide's glass panel shattered mid-ride, injuring a male guest. Water flooded the deck as passengers screamed for the ride to stop. Royal Caribbean is investigating the incident, and the slide is closed for the remainder of the cruise after the ship departed from Miami on August 2, 2023.

title: Trump to meet Putin on Aug 15: Talks to take place in Alaska; focus on ending Ukraine war
content: President Donald Trump announced a meeting with Russian President Vladimir Putin in Alaska on August 15, 2025, to discuss ending the ongoing war in Ukraine. This marks Putin's first visit to the US in a decade, signaling a potential shift in diplomatic efforts. Trump expressed optimism about brokering a peace deal, despite previous failed talks between Moscow and Kyiv.

title: ‚ÄòNot to occupy but free Gaza‚Äô: Netanyahu defends Israel's military plans
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu declared Israel's aim to "free" Gaza from Hamas and establish a peaceful civilian government, excluding Hamas, the Palestinian Authority, or any terrorist organization. This statement follows the approval of a military plan involving control of Gaza City, sparking international criticism.

title: Heavy rain in Delhi-NCR: Flights delayed, roads waterlogged; IMD warns of more showers
content: Delhi and the NCR experienced heavy rainfall on Saturday, leading to flight delays and cancellations, with approximately 90 flights affected and several areas waterlogged. The IMD has forecast continued thunderstorms and rain throughout the day in the capital.

title: Operation Akhal enters day 9: Two soldiers killed in J&K's Kulgam
content: An ongoing encounter in Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam district, under Operation Akhal, has resulted in the death of two soldiers, confirmed by the Army on Saturday. The operation, initiated on August 1, has also led to the killing of two unidentified terrorists.

title: 'I am a little bit like Ashwin': Ambidextrous Nivethan hopes to emulate Lyon
content: Chennai-born Nivethan Radhakrishnan, an ambidextrous spinner playing for Tasmania, is honing his skills at the MRF Academy in Chennai. Inspired by Ashwin and Lyon, the 22-year-old aims to enhance his consistency and variety. He is part of Cricket Australia's developmental squad, focusing on mastering both off-spin and leg-spin to excel in Australian domestic cricket.

title: 'Mohammed Siraj needs to be cautious about workload'
content: RP Singh cautioned that Mohammed Siraj needs workload management despite his impressive performance in England, similar to Jasprit Bumrah's situation. He advocated for monitoring workload in domestic cricket rather than international matches. Singh also supported Arshdeep Singh's inclusion in the team and believed Anshul Kamboj has potential despite a poor debut due to lack of rest.

title: Rahane hails Bumrah's courage: 'Sometimes players convey message and get dropped'
content: Ajinkya Rahane praised Jasprit Bumrah's transparent communication regarding his workload management for the England Test series. Bumrah's decision to play only three Tests, despite being a key player, demonstrated his commitment to the team's needs. Rahane advised the management to use Bumrah in shorter spells to ensure his availability for future series, highlighting his impact on England's 'Bazball' approach.

title: Selena Gomez opens up about Taylor Swift reportedly ending all ties with Blake Lively
content: Amidst personal changes, Taylor Swift's friendship with Blake Lively reportedly ended due to legal issues involving Justin Baldoni. Selena Gomez discussed her long-standing bond with Swift, revealing their shared history of dating Jonas Brothers. Swift and Kelce are expected at Gomez's wedding. Swift has been seen reconnecting with Gomez, while distancing herself from Lively and Ryan Reynolds.

title: 'Short tempered': Huma Qureshi cousin murdered in Delhi - accused brothers known for picking fights
content: In Delhi's Jangpura, Asif Qureshi, cousin of actress Huma Qureshi, was fatally stabbed following a parking dispute with brothers Ujjawal and Gautam. The altercation escalated after Qureshi asked Ujjawal to move his scooter, leading to a violent confrontation. Both brothers, known for their aggressive temper and prior history of altercations, have been arrested by the police.

title: ‚ÄòWill kill anyone working with Salman Khan‚Äô: Kapil Sharma's caf√© shooting
content: Comedian Kapil Sharma is now under threat from the Lawrence Bishnoi syndicate due to his connection with Salman Khan. This follows a shooting at Sharma's restaurant in Canada, claimed by the Bishnoi gang. An audio clip reveals threats against those working with Khan, vowing violence, even murder, using AK-47s.

title: Marathi vs non-Marathi row: MNS men assault idli vendor in Kalyan; heated spat erupts on train
content: Recent incidents highlight the Marathi versus non-Marathi divide in Maharashtra. In Kalyan, MNS workers allegedly assaulted an idli vendor for derogatory remarks. A video from a local train shows a heated argument between two women over language preference. Police have not received formal complaints in either case. The incidents underscore existing tensions in the state.

title: Watch: When Pandya dismissed Haider Ali, Pakistani cricketer arrested on rape charges
content: Pakistani cricketer Haider Ali has been arrested in Manchester on rape charges stemming from an alleged incident on July 23, 2025. Greater Manchester Police are investigating, and Ali has been released on bail. His young career so far has included the iconic India vs Pakistan match at the 2022 T20 World Cup but he was unable to make a mark in that contest.

title: India seeks 200 copters to replace ageing Cheetah & Chetak fleet
content: India is urgently seeking to replace its aging Cheetah and Chetak helicopters, which are plagued by safety concerns and outdated technology. The Army has issued a request for information to acquire 120 reconnaissance and surveillance helicopters, while the IAF needs 80, aiming to modernize its fleet and enhance operational capabilities after decades of delays.

title: 'Could have used better language': Ex-Aussie star weighs in on Gambhir‚Äìcurator clash
content: Matthew Hayden commented on Gautam Gambhir's heated exchange with the Oval pitch curator, Lee Fortis, during India's training session. Hayden acknowledged Gambhir's frustration with perceived restrictions but suggested he could have used better language. Greg Blewett echoed the sentiment, recalling similar frustrations and noting the language used wasn't ideal, despite India securing a series-levelling victory.

title: Amid escalation with US, PM Modi and Putin back India-Russia ties
content: Amidst strained US-India relations due to trade disputes over Russian ties, PM Modi and President Putin reaffirmed their commitment to strengthening India-Russia relations. Modi expressed support for resolving the Russia-Ukraine conflict through diplomacy and invited Putin to India for the annual summit.

title: WTC glory needs specialists, not stopgaps ‚Äî Gambhir must rethink his approach
content: Under Gautam Gambhir, India have played 15 Test matches, winning five and losing eight, including an embarrassing series defeat at home to New Zealand, their first in 12 years. His red-ball tactics have raised eyebrows; his rigidity in prioritising batting depth over balance, and his decision to keep Kuldeep Yadav on the bench, cost India a golden chance to bury the Bazballers once and for all. India did manage to draw the series, thanks to a spirited performance by the extraordinary skills of Mohammed Siraj, but they should have beaten toothless England.

title: India won't bow down to anybody, says Piyush Goyal
content: Piyush Goyal asserted India's resilience, stating it won't bow down to anyone and will capitalize on global trade restructuring. He expressed confidence in India's economic strength and ability to find opportunities amidst crises like potential Trump tariffs. Goyal highlighted India's growing global recognition and attractiveness as a market, dismissing concerns about its economic status.

title: 51-foot-tall statue of Lord Ram unveiled in Canada's Mississauga
content: A towering 51-foot statue of Lord Ram, inspired by the Ayodhya temple, has been unveiled in Mississauga, becoming North America's tallest. Made in Delhi and assembled in Canada, the statue can withstand high winds and is visible from Toronto airport. The inauguration was celebrated by the Hindu community and attended by Canadian politicians, marking a significant spiritual landmark.

title: Watch: Ashwin's cheeky take on IPL rumours leaves Samson, fans in splits
content: Ravichandran Ashwin cleverly addressed IPL trade rumours in a new video, engaging Rajasthan Royals skipper Sanju Samson in a humorous exchange about potential team switches. Ashwin joked about trading himself to stay in Kerala, while reports suggest Samson's unhappiness with RR and CSK's interest in signing him. This playful banter turns transfer speculation into lighthearted entertainment for fans.

title: NFL star Tyreek Hill and ex-wife Keeta's baby Capri rushed to ER; now on the mend
content: Tyreek Hill's eight-month-old daughter, Capri, was rushed to the emergency room after developing alarming symptoms, causing significant concern for her mother, Keeta Vaccaro. Doctors swiftly stabilized Capri, and her condition improved by sunrise. Despite ongoing family turmoil, the outpouring of support from fans highlights the shared relief and gratitude for Capri's recovery.

title: Jaz Agassi‚Äôs sweet support for dad Andre Agassi ‚Äî Steffi Graf moment resurfaces
content: Andre Agassi addressed Shore Capital Partner‚Äôs Leadership Academy in New York City on July 14, 2025, emphasizing leadership, mindset, and purpose. Following the fireside chat with Jish Bia, Agassi's daughter, Jaz, expressed her admiration on Instagram. Agassi has previously discussed parenting and his efforts to break negative cycles, highlighting his and Steffi Graf's influence on their children.

title: US tariffs: Shoemakers take measured steps
content: India's non-leather footwear industry in Tamil Nadu, a hub for global brands, faces a potential crisis due to a looming 50% US tariff. Brands like Nike and Crocs may pause new export orders, fearing eroded competitiveness compared to Vietnam and Indonesia. Apparel exporters are also pressured to shift US production elsewhere.

title: Fee regulation Bill ignores audits, backs schools: Atishi
content: Recalling the previous AAP government‚Äôs efforts to regulate fee hikes, she said her party in 2015 had sent the fee hike Bill to the Central government, but it was not approved.

title: Parents of R.G. Kar victim to lead march to West Bengal  Secretariat to mark one year of the crime
content:
¬†
Family sends invitations to political parties except Trinamool; police issue prohibitory orders, mark Howrah‚Äôs Santragachi Bus Stand and Kolkata‚Äôs Rani Rashmoni Avenue as alternative venues for rally

title: State Education Policy: move to scrap board exam for Class XI faces criticism in Tamil Nadu
content: D. Ravikumar, VCK MP, expressed concern that the move would not only adversely affect higher secondary education but also bring down the quality of higher and vocational education.

title: Chief Minister Stalin presents awards to Tamil scholars at Kamban Vizha 2025
content: He says the Dravidian movement viewed the Kamba Ramayana from a different perspective, praising the work for its poetry and the richness of its Tamil

title: Ensure freedom of expression does not hurt religious feelings, Madras HC tells State government
content: The Madurai Bench of the Madras High Court has set aside the closure of a case registered by the Thoothukudi police over a social media post disrespecting Lord Krishna

title: Stir against SIR a meeting point for Trinamool and Congress
content: The Trinamool Congress has often said that it is the only party in the INDIA bloc to not have an electoral alliance with the Congress. However, at a dinner meet hosted by Rahul Gandhi, the two sides seemed to have turned a page

title: Karnataka SEP panel recommends two-language policy, Kannada/mother tongue as medium of instruction
content: The SEP has proposed to mandate Kannada/mother tongue as the medium of instruction at least until Class 5, and preferably up to Class 12 (II PUC)

title: Rajnath postpones U.S. visit; defence purchases unaffected
content: Minister was to go to U.S. this month-end to boost defence ties with the signing of a 10-year plan; officials reject reports that India has stopped defence purchases from U.S. in response to tariff row

title: CM to inaugurate super-speciality block at Kannur district hospital
content: Built under the ‚ÄòAardram‚Äô Mission and funded by the Kerala Infrastructure Investment Fund Board (KIIFB), the five-storey facility brings advanced medical services under one roof, with outpatient departments for cardiology, nephrology, and oncology

title: Government approves MERITE scheme to strengthen technical institutes
content: The scheme, with an outlay of ‚Çπ4,200 crore for five years, aims to develop guidelines for multidisciplinary programmes in technical courses, and increase learning and employability skills

title: Indrakeeladri to host mass Varalakshmi Vratham on August 22
content: The presiding deity atop Indrakeeladri Goddess Kanaka Durga adorned and worshipped as Sri Varalakshmi Devi on the occasion of ‚ÄúSravana Masam Vara Lakshmi Devi pooja‚Äù

title: Left parties to observe protest day on August 28 against power tariff hikes, smart meters
content: Date marks 25 years since 2000 electricity reforms stir; parties also slam government for aiding private steel projects over Visakha Steel Plant.

title: Russia is not Iran, India can‚Äôt cancel oil imports on U.S. demand: experts
content: Former Ambassador to Washington says Trump tariffs, penalty reviving ‚Äòbitter memories‚Äô of previous U.S. coercive actions

title: Madras High Court restrains functioning of office-bearers appointed by DMK to MTC trade union without conducting elections
content: Justice K. Kumaresh Babu grants the interim injunction pursuant to a civil suit filed by 59 members of Metropolitan Transport Corporation Oozhiyar Progressive Union

title: Andhra Pradesh records 52% kharif sowing amid rainfall deficit
content: Principal crop paddy sees sowing in 8.11 lakh hectares reaching 55% of seasonal target, maize, ragi, bajra performing well with sowing percentages of 88, 89, and 72 respectively; Chittoor district leads State with 167% of its seasonal normal area sown

title: Police rescue baby hours after father sells her away for ‚Çπ5,000 to a couple
content: The accused who bought the three-year-old planned to maim her and use her for seeking alms, say railway police

title: KHB plans a mega sports centre in Surya City to house a cricket stadium of 80,000 seating capacity
content: This will likely be the second largest cricket stadium in the country after the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad, which has a seating capacity of 1,32,000

title: Uttarkashi flash floods: Rescue efforts at Dharali continue, heavy rain forecast
content: Administration deploys thermal imaging cameras and sniffer dogs to look for survivors; residents from nearby village say toll could be higher as 50 labourers were working at a site when the flash flood struck

title: Rights panel asks home dept. to decide on estimate for maintenance of water tank in Ernakulam district jail
content: SHRC Chairman directs the Additional Chief Secretary (Home department) to decide on the matter within a month of receiving the estimate from the head of the Prison dept.

title: Kerala HC denies life convict‚Äôs plea for emergency parole
content: Most fundamental rights of convicts remain suspended after conviction and cannot be diluted by granting emergency leave regularly, except in truly extraordinary situations, the court observes

title: Task force for well-being of students unveils portal
content: Initiative seeks views from students, parents, faculty, experts and public to inform report to apex court

title: Akshaya entrepreneurs in Ernakulam suspend K-Smart services over low service charges
content: Service fees were revised only once in 23 years, say entrepreneurs, who argue that ‚Çπ50 for a 30-minute ownership change or ‚Çπ70 for a 45-minute marriage registration is unsustainable

title: Sharp drop in child labour cases in Andhra Pradesh, say officials
content: Stricter enforcement of laws, rehabilitation of rescued children, and better coordination among departments drive the decline, while officials urge continued vigilance to end the practice completely

title: High Court issues notices to CCLA
content: Petitioners challenged the order passed by the Chief Commission of Land Administration declaring two parcels of land in Sulthanpally village as government lands

title: Bombay High Court orders reinstatement of 53 contract workers terminated in 1995
content: Calling the denial of reinstatement a ‚Äúgrave travesty of justice,‚Äù the Bombay High Court has directed the Thane Municipal Corporation to reinstate 53 contract workers terminated in 1995.¬†

title: Punjab‚Äôs land pooling policy faces question over intent, transparency from stakeholders
content: Farmer unions, political parties, and academics question transparency and intent; High Court grants interim stay

title: 2K details NBA 2K26 presentation and MyPlayer improvements
content: 2K and Visual Concepts are looking for graphical improvements with every new game . a new shader allows NBA 2K26 to portray sweat on athletes' bodies . the stitching on uniforms will be visible, giving names and numbers on the jerseys more presence .

title: Explaining MLS' discovery rights: What were M√ºller's extra steps to Vancouver?
content: MLS commissioner don Garber speaks about the potential change to the league's schedule after the 2026 FIFA World Cup . atypical but significant mechanism in MLS's single-entity structure called the Discovery List . the regulation allows teams to "discover" and select up to five non-MLS players .

title: NBA's new financial rules threaten dynasties: 'Harder choices' for top teams
content: Iman Shumpert is looking forward to seeing how the Thunder respond after winning the title . since the Warriors won back-to-back titles in 2017 and 2018, the NBA has seen seven different champions hoist the Larry O'Brien Trophy . there have been 11 different finalists in each of the past six postseasons .
